articles.headline: Geithner Sets Limits on Lobbying for Bailout Money
articles.snippet: The Treasury secretary said he would crack down on lobbying to influence the financial bailout program by companies that are receiving funds.
articles.abstract: The Treasury secretary said he would crack down on lobbying to influence the financial bailout program by companies that are receiving funds.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The new Treasury secretary, Timothy F. Geithner, announced on Tuesday that he would crack down on lobbying to influence the $700 billion financial bailout program by companies that are receiving billions in taxpayer money.

articles.headline: Yang’s Era at Yahoo Ends With a Loss
articles.snippet: Yahoo reported a net loss of $303 million for the quarter on a number of one-time charges and sales were slightly down as more marketers pulled back on spending.
articles.abstract: Yahoo reported a net loss of $303 million for the quarter on a number of one-time charges and sales were slightly down as more marketers pulled back on spending.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Will Carol A. Bartz sell Yahoo’s search business to Microsoft?

articles.headline: Troubled Times Bring Mini-Madoffs to Light
articles.snippet: The number of possible Ponzi schemes being reported to authorities has doubled since last year.
articles.abstract: The number of possible Ponzi schemes being reported to authorities has doubled since last year.
articles.lead_paragraph: Their names lack the Dickensian flair of Bernie Madoff, and the money they apparently stole from investors was a small fraction of the $50 billion that Mr. Madoff allegedly lost of his clients’ savings.

articles.headline: Aides Say Obama’s Afghan Aims Elevate War
articles.snippet: President Obama intends to adopt a tougher line toward President Hamid Karzai and focus more on waging war.
articles.abstract: President Obama intends to adopt a tougher line toward President Hamid Karzai and focus more on waging war.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  President Obama intends to adopt a tougher line toward Hamid Karzai, the Afghan president, as part of a new American approach to Afghanistan that will put more emphasis on waging war than on development, senior administration officials said Tuesday.
articles.byline: By Helene Cooper and Thom Shanker

articles.headline: Relief Seen for Jobless and States in Health Care Plan
articles.snippet: For Democrats, the stimulus bill is also a tool for rewriting the social contract with the poor, the uninsured and the unemployed.
articles.abstract: For Democrats, the stimulus bill is also a tool for rewriting the social contract with the poor, the uninsured and the unemployed.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The stimulus bill working its way through Congress is not just a package of spending increases and tax cuts intended to jolt the nation out of recession. For Democrats, it is also a tool for rewriting the social contract with the poor, the uninsured and the unemployed, in ways they have long yearned to do.

articles.headline: Self-Publishers Flourish as Writers Pay the Tab
articles.snippet: Companies that charge writers to publish are growing while many mainstream publishers are losing ground.
articles.abstract: Companies that charge writers to publish are growing while many mainstream publishers are losing ground.
articles.lead_paragraph: The point may soon come when there are more people who want to write books than there are people who want to read them.

articles.headline: Bank of America Board Under Gun From Critics
articles.snippet: An eclectic group, the board of Bank of America is under scrutiny for the way it has handled overseeing the bank’s chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis.
articles.abstract: An eclectic group, the board of Bank of America is under scrutiny for the way it has handled overseeing the bank’s chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis.
articles.lead_paragraph: Gen. Tommy R. Franks, the former chief of the Public Broadcasting System and the publisher of a Spanish newspaper would seem to have nothing in common  except for one thing. They all sit on the board of Bank of America.
articles.byline: By Louise Story and Julie Creswell

articles.headline: A Stimulus With Merit, and Misses Too
articles.snippet: While it does well by several yardsticks, the plan fails to reflect the reformist thinking that President Obama presented in his campaign and neglects projects that could make a difference.
articles.abstract: While it does well by several yardsticks, the plan fails to reflect the reformist thinking that President Obama presented in his campaign and neglects projects that could make a difference.
